item.title: Major Earthquake M Earthquake Occurred.
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
EARTHQUAKE  HAS OCCURRED <LOCATION>ewrwer

BC officials are monitoring the situation. Stand by for more information.

In the meantime, earthquake and tsunami reports are available from:

  • USGS
  • Natural Resources Canada
  • National Tsunami Warning Center

REMAIN CALM

  • Stay calm and move carefully, checking for unstable objects and other hazards above and around you.
  • If you felt the earthquake, report it here. Always reserve 911 for life safety issues.

LISTEN TO INSTRUCTIONS

  • Tune to your local radio or television station. If there is a need for further action in your community, local authorities will provide the necessary instructions.

CHECK FOR INJURIES

  • Treat your own injuries and, if qualified, give first aid to others.
  • Seriously injured people should NOT be moved unless doing so is the only way to avoid imminent danger or further injury.

CHECK FOR DAMAGE & HAZARDS

  • Check for obvious structural damage or hazards such as: fires; gas leaks; exposed/arcing electrical components/wires; leaking sewage; broken water pipes; and dangling fixtures/furnishings.
  • Check utilities and do not shut them off unless damaged.
  • If you smell leaking gas, leave the house immediately.
  • Do not light candles, matches or lighters until you have fully assessed the area and have cleaned up any spilled hazardous materials.
  • If you have to evacuate, take your family emergency kit with you.

COMMUNICATE & CONNECT

  • Check on neighbours after attending to your own household.
  • Avoid tying up phone lines unless a life is at stake. Update personal social media sites or use text messaging to let people know you are okay.
  • If you are at home, place a large OK sign in your window to let emergency workers know.

EXPECT AFTERSHOCKS

  • Aftershocks are likely. Drop, cover and hold on every time you feel one.
  • Wait for the shaking to stop and count to 60 before getting up.
  • Avoid areas near windows. Protect your head and face.

item.title: TEMPLATE TSUNAMI: [Magnitude] earthquake detected [at location]. Tsunami [Warning, Advisory, Watch] issued for B.C. [Date].
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
<DELETE BEFORE POSTING: change title, date and time, check location below and check URL permalink above before posting>

A [magnitude] earthquake has occurred [at location]. A Tsunami [Warning, Advisory, Watch] has been issued for B.C. [or, the risk is currently being evaluated]. This page will be updated as information becomes available.

Follow all instructions from local officials. If directed to head to high ground or inland, do so immediately. Do NOT call 9-1-1 to report the earthquake, only call 9-1-1 when a life is at stake.  It is important these lines stay free for those in immediate need.

Preliminary Earthquake Parameters

The following parameters are based on a rapid preliminary assessment of the earthquake and changes may occur.

  • Magnitude:
  • Origin Time:
  • Coordinates:
  • Depth:
  • Location:

Resources

The latest earthquake and tsunami reports are available from:

  • USGS
  • Natural Resources Canada
  • National Tsunami Warning Center
  • Environment Canada Alerts

Coastal B.C. Tsunami Notification Zones

  • Zone A
  • Zone B
  • Zone C
  • Zone D
  • Zone E

Tsunami Definitions

Warning: Flood wave possible. Full evacuation suggested.
Advisory: Strong currents likely. Stay away from the shore.
Watch: Danger level not yet known. Stay alert for more information.
Information Statement: Minor waves at most. No action suggested.
Cancellation: Tidal gauges show no wave activity. Confirm safety for local areas.

item.title: Emergency Alert: [Emergency Action] for [location] due to [hazard]. [Date].
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
HEADER [delete]: Emergency Alert: [Emergency Action] for [location] due to [hazard]. [Date].

An [issuance, e.g. Evacuation Order, Tactical Evacuation, etc.] and an Emergency Alert has been issued by [requester] due to [hazard]. Impacted residents should evacuate the area immediately.

Alert Message

[paste alert message text]

Evacuation Area

Refer to the Evacuation Order map [LINK] if you are unsure if this order applies to you:

[insert alert area map if available]

If you are in the impacted area and received this alert:

  • Stop what you are doing and follow the directions provided
  • Follow all instructions from local officials
  • Do not call 9-1-1 for additional information unless you are trapped and unable to evacuate.
  • [Insert additional instructions as identified—ESS reception, traffic/routes, etc.]

This alert was broadcast on TV and radio and to compatible and connected wireless devices in and near the impacted area. These messages are geographically targeted, but may also reach residents in surrounding areas. If you are not in the affected area, disregard this alert.

If you’re unsure if this alert applies to you, refer to the Evacuation Order map or seek information from local officials.

[Pull any other info from LA/FN evacuation order or website]

Related Links

  • What to expect during emergency evacuation
  • How emergency alerts work in BC
  • [What to expect during flooding in BC]
  • [What to expect during a wildfire in BC]
  • [Add other hazard specific resources/links, if appropriate]

item.title: Recommended Actions
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Recommended Actions

1

If you are under Evacuation Order, you are at risk and must leave immediately

2

Follow all directions from officials and evacuate using the following route(s): [insert route here]

3

Refer to the Evacuation Order for information specific to your community

4

If you have been displaced from your home due to this emergency, self-register for Emergency Support Services.

item.content:encoded:
Links & Resources

Informative plain language intro text for the general public.

Issuing authority links

Authority X have provided such information

Link 1 goes here

Link 2 goes here

Flood evacuee guidance

This website provides you with some tips if a flooding is imminent, if an evacuation alert is in place or if an evacuation order is in place.

River Forecast Centre

Consult the River Forecast Centre website for the latest updates on flood advisories.

DriveBC

DriveBC provides you with the latest travel and highway updates for save travel.

item.title: Get Prepared
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Get prepared for a flood

Informative plain language intro text for the general public.

Develop a household plan

An emergency plan says how to respond to a disaster. Knowing what to do will reduce anxiety and help keep you focused and safe.

Connect with your neighbours

Connecting with our neighbors before a disaster strikes can help us prepare for emergencies together, share resources, and support each other in times of need.

Put together an emergency kit

Building an emergency kit and grab-and-go bag can help you quickly and easily access essential supplies during an emergency or evacuation.

PreparedBC

Being prepared for flooding is essential as it can save lives, protect property and reduce the overall impact on communities.
